```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)

library(here)
library(data.table)
library(tidyverse)
library(readxl)
library(janitor)
library(lubridate)

## Sets R not to use scientific notations
options(scipen=999) 

```


## Read data

```{r}
osp_raw <- read_excel(here::here("raw_data/A.Wegmann_OSP2004.xlsx")) %>% 
  clean_names()
```


## Checking data

```{r}
str(osp_raw)

## Column that have "*" are read as character instead of numeric

sort(unique(osp_raw$date))
sort(unique(osp_raw$year))

## Year is numeric and there is one value 2004.51 tat needs to be 2005

## Check is any of the last columns has data
unique(osp_raw$x1)
unique(osp_raw$x2_24)
unique(osp_raw$x2_25)
unique(osp_raw$x3)
unique(osp_raw$x4)

## All NAs, no data.
```



## Cleaning data

```{r}

osp_clean <- osp_raw %>% 
  ## Removing columns with no data
  select(1:22) %>% 
  ## Replace * for NA
  mutate(across(11:22, ~replace(., . ==  "*" , NA)),
         across(11:22, ~as.numeric(.)),
         across(9:11, ~as.factor(.)),
         across(2, ~as.factor(.)),
         ## correcting year
         year = case_when(year == 2004.51026392962 ~ 2005,
                          T ~ year)) %>% 
  rename(av_dbh = av_dbh_cm,
         max_dbh = max_dbh_cm,
         height = height_m)
## Check
str(osp_clean)

```


## Save clean data

```{r}
write_csv(osp_clean, here::here("clean_data/osp2004.csv"))

```
